greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) = number of labeled partitions of (n,k) into pairs (i,j).
comment: Partitions of n black objects labeled 1..n and n white objects labeled 1..n. Each partition must have at least one black object and at least one white object.
program: (PARI) antidiag(nn) = {for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, n, print1(sum(m=1, min(k, n-k+1), m!*stirling(k, m, 2)*stirling(n-k+1, m, 2)), ", "); ); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 11 2015

(PARI) tabl(nn) = {default(seriesprecision, nn); for (n=1, nn, for (k=1, nn, print1(k!*polcoeff(polcoeff(n!*exp((exp(x)-1)*(exp(y)-1))+O(x^(n+1)), n, x), k, y), ", "); ); print(););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 11 2015
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jun 03 2005
